Definition: The process of producing goods through various methods, including assembly lines and production facilities.
The creation or manufacture of goods and services within an industry.
The tools, machinery, and methods used in industrial processes to improve efficiency and output.
The workforce and human resources involved in the production and operation of industries.
The network of organizations and activities involved in the creation and distribution of products within an industry.
The larger system of production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services within a region or country, in which industries play a significant role.
The development and implementation of new ideas, technologies, and processes within industries.
The practice of conducting industrial activities in a way that minimizes negative environmental and social impacts.
The demand and potential consumer base for products and services created by industries.
The rivalry among companies and organizations within an industry for market share and profitability.
The rules, laws, and standards set by governments to govern and oversee industrial practices.
The process of industries expanding their operations and markets on a global scale.
The planning, management, and coordination of the flow of materials, information, and products within industries.
The processes and measures taken to ensure the consistency and quality of products within an industry.
The systematic investigation and experimentation to create new products, technologies, or processes within industries.
